channel.title: Edward Atkin's Homepage
channel.description: The personal homepage of Edward Atkin

item.title: SQL Queries That You’ll Never Need (But Should Try Anyway)
item.description: Let’s head to Codewars, a user-run site for creating and solving technical problems.

item.title: My Keyboard is a Mouse
item.description: I go my first mechanical keyboard this year, picked up a nice second hand Ducky One with brown switches. It was fantastic. I was fully assimilated into the MK guild. Then it broke.

item.title: Someone Finally Finds a Real World Use Case for a Binary Search Algorithm
item.description: The binary search algorithm is a certified classic, a staple of Computer Science, beautifully elegant and so simple, yet so smart. Often used to test a programmer's technical prowess. The issue is: when have you ever, EVER, needed a binary search algorithm?

item.title: Resurrecting the Photo a Day Project With Face Recognition
item.description: Using facial recognition to resurrect a photo a day project from 9 years ago.
